poem:
Title: "Invisible Stitches of Dignity"

In the hush of Tees Valley morn,
Raw hands, a mother relents,
Her tale of five jobs silently worn,
On threads of dignity, each day spent.

A school where poverty's seams fray,
Yet tugged by the gentlest of hands,
They sew hope into every day,
In the heart of these worn lands.
